c74object.name: sadam.tcpReceiver
c74object.digest: Receive data from the network using the TCP protocol
c74object.description:
sadam.tcpReceiver
will listen to a specified port and output incoming data. Currently it will output everything as pure binary data (by sending out the received bytes one-by-one on the leftmost outlet and, optionally, by adding them to the registered binary streams represented by
sadam.stream) but a later release will support any arbitrary Max message.
This object was commissioned by Andrea Szigetvári and the Hungarian Computer Music Foundation.

inlet.name: INLET_NAME
inlet.digest: Various messages to set port etc.
inlet.description: Various messages to set port etc.

outlet.name: OUTLET_NAME
outlet.digest: (int/list) Error code. On success, it will output 0 followed by the IP address and port of the sender.
outlet.description: (int/list) Error code. On success, it will output 0 followed by the IP address and port of the sender.

objarg.name: port
objarg.description: Sets the recipient port number. Valid port numbers are between 0 and 65535.

objarg.name: buffer
objarg.description: Sets the initial size of the TCP cache in bytes. Default is 2048.

objarg.name: stream name
objarg.description:
Binds the object to a binary stream represented by
sadam.stream .

method.name: bind
method.digest: Without an argument, it will unregister all previously registered binary streams. If an argument is present, it will also register the stream with the given name to the object. If a stream is registered, each time a new binary sequence arrives, first it will be added to the end of the registered stream and then the stream will be cleared.
method.description: Without an argument, it will unregister all previously registered binary streams. If an argument is present, it will also register the stream with the given name to the object. If a stream is registered, each time a new binary sequence arrives, first it will be added to the end of the registered stream and then the stream will be cleared.

method.name: buffer
method.digest: Sets the size of the TCP cache in bytes. This is the maximum length of arriving messages. Note that, even if you create a huge receiver buffer, the actual maximum length of your message will be affected by every server on the network between you and the sender.
method.description: Sets the size of the TCP cache in bytes. This is the maximum length of arriving messages. Note that, even if you create a huge receiver buffer, the actual maximum length of your message will be affected by every server on the network between you and the sender.

method.name: maxconnect
method.digest: Sets the maximum number of simultaneous connections allowed for this object. The default value is 10.
method.description: Sets the maximum number of simultaneous connections allowed for this object. The default value is 10.

method.name: port
method.digest: Sets the port on which the data should be sent. Valid range is from 0 to 65535.
method.description: Sets the port on which the data should be sent. Valid range is from 0 to 65535.

method.name: register
method.digest:
Registers the stream with the given name to the object. More than one stream can be registered to the same object. Unlike the message
bind
, it will not unregister other (already registered) streams.
method.description:
Registers the stream with the given name to the object. More than one stream can be registered to the same object. Unlike the message
bind
, it will not unregister other (already registered) streams.

method.name: unregister
method.digest: Unregisters the stream with the given name from the object.
method.description: Unregisters the stream with the given name from the object.

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.digest: If non-zero, it will report activity to the Max window.
attribute.description: If non-zero, it will report activity to the Max window. Default value is (1).
